result.execSummary:
The defendant Teagan J. Spaay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to maintain FTW/School or a combination of the two.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

Assessments/counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and follow up.
Letter of apology to victims: S.B. & C.S.; Weston Pick N Save and Ribt Mt Walmart Store #60.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Teagan J. Spaay

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
